lexUnit.name: perish.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: die, especially in large numbers.

sentence.text: This will occur if for example the buyer has had some use of the goods and subsequently they perished thereby frustrating the contract .
Fortunately , the crew were not then aware that in recent recorded history three men had perished trying to walk the same route in midwinter .
Celia perished trying to help some natives dying of pestilence .
I have to bless this tower before it falls down or the masons perish of liver-rot . "
He that liveth by the sword shall perish by the sword .

They perished from hunger
She points out that the cash squeeze could be relaxed quickly if Brazilian inflation really does perish from a single shot .
Many of these species perished in the attempt .
